pull.title: Move CMerkleBlock and CPartialMerkleTree to their own file

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

events.body: Verified move-only other than the necessary header changes and the MAX_BLOCK_SIZE change I nagged about.
I moved MAX_BLOCK_SIZE to core/block.h, though in a separate commit, merger can chose to include that or not based on random coin flip (as long as its fair based on bitcoin block hashes).

issue.title: Add RPC call to generate and verify merkle blocks
issue.body:
(based on #5181 as it would otherwise conflict and I'm lazy.)

Adds RPC calls to generate (and verify) merkle blocks which, though verify is less useful for Bitcoin Core, just making them more accessible so that (hopefully) they become useful for people to exchange around would be very nice.

Full Disclosure: This is required to sidechain-related work.

events.message: Move CMerkleBlock and CPartialMerkleTree to their own file

events.body:
Oh this moves things out of main.cpp/h. That's nice!
ACK verified move-only
commithash afd4b94b6dabab29dee5a12966ce217700381682
([signature](https://dev.visucore.com/bitcoin/acks/5181))

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,155 @@

+

+
+#include "hash.h"
+//#include "main.h" // for MAX_BLOCK_SIZE
+static const unsigned int MAX_BLOCK_SIZE = 1000000;
comments.body: Can we move out of main instead of duplicating it? Other files need this too and could drop their dependency on main.h (bitcoin-tx.cpp for ex).
